title: Maweke
text:
According to the <a href="Hawaii">Hawaii</a>an chants, Chief Maweke (also spelled Māweke in Hawaiian; Hawaiian pronunciation: "MAH-WEH-KEH") was a chief of the highest known rank who lived in the 11th century. He is described in the legends as a wizard (or priest, "<a href="kahuna">kahuna</a>" in <a href="Hawaiian%20language">Hawaiian language</a>) and an "<a href="Ali%CA%BBi">Aliʻi</a>" (a noble) of "the blue blood" (a Hawaiian nobleman of the highest rank). He was an ancestor of the royalty of the island of <a href="Oahu">Oahu</a>.
He was not of Hawaiian origin, but came to Hawaii from <a href="Tahiti">Tahiti</a> and was famous for his knowledge of black <a href="Magic%20%28supernatural%29">magic</a>. His famous ancestor was <a href="Nanaulu">Nanaulu</a>.
His parents are named in the chants as Kekupahaikala (father) and Maihikea (mother).
When he arrived to Oahu, Maweke erected a temple to the <a href="god">god</a> called <a href="Kanaloa">Kanaloa</a>.
Maweke married woman named Naiolaukea (Naiolakea). They had children:
